docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: In large cities, where but few of the inhabitants belong to the laboring professions, and where there is little opportunity for physical exercise, we must not wonder that offeminacy so generally prevails among both sexes--that soft hands and graceful limbs are preferable to developed forms, a healthy complexion; and vigorous muscles.

headline.main: MORAL AND RELIGIOUS.; Church and Missionory Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The want of ministers is becoming a matter of more frequent complaint in most of the religious denommations. From the representations of the papers, it would seem that a larger number of Churches are without regular preachers than at any previous time. It was recently stated that some ten or twelve of the large Congregational Churches in Newt Hampahire are vacant, as at Concord, Exeter, Boscawen, Nashua,

headline.main: CORRESPONDENCE.; GREAT BRITAIN. Preparations for the Duke's Funeral--Meeting of the New Parliament--General Intelligence--Theatrical, Musical, &c. &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE MANCHESTER LEAGUE. The Manchester "League"--resuscitated, and once more in arms in defence of the great principle of free trade--had its banquet on Tuesday last, if "banquet " it can be called, when a sorry set-out of Sandwiches, pies and tarts and other semi-regetarian viands constituted the bill of fare.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: MR. MACAULAY'S SPEECH.; Great Meeting in Edinburgh--Review of the Ministerial Policy. Letter from Lord Maidstone. English Views of the Presidential Election.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday afternoon Mr. MACAULAY addressed the electors of Edinburgh for the first time since' his election in July last. It will be remembered that the right Hon. gentleman was on that occasion elected in his absence, and without his solicitation, and that, on receiving intimation of that gratifying fact, he promised to appear among the electors in a few days and thank them Ior their kindness.

docs.lead_paragraph: The full report of the Census has not, to our knowledge, reached our City as yet. The "Abstract" is before us, and contains some important information in a very compact form. In respect to territory, it appears that during the last ten years, we have extended the area of the United States from 2,055,153 to 3,230,572 square miles, without including the great lakes, or the sea-bays.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; SOCIETY FOR THE RELIEF OF WIDOWS WITH SMALL CHILDREN. MEETING OF THE PUBLIC CARTMEN. ACCIDENT ON THE NEW-HAVEN TRAIN. BOARD OF ASSISTANTS COURT CALENDAR. SUPERIOR COURT BEFORE JUDGE CAMPBELL. SUPERIOR COURT

docs.lead_paragraph: SOCIETY FOR THE RELIEF OF WIDOWS WITH SMALL CHILDREN.--This old and most beneficent charitable Ladies' Association met yesterday morning at the Lecture Room in the Church of Rev. Dr. POTTS, in University Place. The following Report, read by the Secretary, sets forth the specific objects of the Institution, with the degree to which hitherto they have been attained:...

docs.lead_paragraph: The clergy, unlike those in most other professions, enter into the heaviest part of their work at first. They accept a call, and at once have all their sermons to write, their lectures to prepare, their visits to make, just like their elder brethren, but without their abundance of " preparation " to assist them when cramped. Few other professions are so.

headline.main: LITERARY.; Dr. .Franklin. John Adams. and Lord Howe.

docs.lead_paragraph: In 1776, Lord Hows having intimated to Congress, verbally, by General SULLIVAN, who had been his prisoner, his desire to confer with some of the members in a private unofficial way, on the subject of putting an end to their difficulties, BEJAMIN FRANKLIN, JOHN ADAMS, and EDWARD RUTLEDGE , were sent as a committee to hear what he had to say.

headline.main: THACKERAY'S NEW WORK.; THE HISTORY OF HENRY ESMOND, ESQ., COLONEL IN THE SERVICE OF HER MAJESTY QUEEN ANNE. Written by himself. By W. M. THACKERAY. Harper & Brothers.
